ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In depth understanding of a variety of synthesis methods.
I learned many ways of synthesizing different kinds of nanomaterials.
A lot of knowledge about nanomaterials ans current work in the field.
Basics of nanomaterial synthesis, especially lithography

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great literature survey of current techniques. Assignments were a bit vague.
Many contents, closely to the advanced updates
I believe this course is well organized, no significant weakness
It gives a very good overview of the field and I think it's very effective.

Good overview on basic methods and characterization techniques for nanoparticles and nanostructures, as well as a little bit on their applications. Powerpoints were sometimes hard to follow due to visibility

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if they are interested in synthesis. Would not recommend if they do not have research experience.
Yes, the class is great, we learned much knowledge that is close to our research.
Yes! It's very important course for students who wants to work for nanomaterials.
Yes, it's a good overview of nanomaterials and helps if you're doing research with nanomaterials
Yes if you are interested in learning more about nanomaterials. However, this class is more for the actual synthesis techniques, per se, not so much on applications.
